mini_project

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • mini_project.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    class for board it is formed form a matrix of fields

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(javax.swing.JLabel bombs, java.awt.Panel mainPanel, int rows, int columns, int numberOfBombs)
      constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkPressedButtonsWin()
      checks if all the button without bombs have been pressed If so the game is won
      void CheckSurroudingFieldForZeroAndExpose(int x, int y)
      this is what checks if a surrounding button has "0" is so expose it and checkZeroAndExpose around the exposed buttons until there is no more "0"'s
      void checkZeroAndExpose(int x, int y)
      first calls the exposeTheSurroundingField because field[x][y] has surroundingBombs(x,y)=0 then calls the surrounding bombs method to check if the newly exposed fields still have surroundingBombs(x,y)=0\ the process is repeated until there are no more fields with 0 unexposed
      void clickedNoFlagNoBomb()
      changes the color of the buttons and if [x][y] is "0" set the label to nothing
      void exposeTheSurroundingFields(int x, int y)
      // exposes the surrounding 8 buttons, because the field has surroungdingBomms = 0, which means there is no bomb can be exposed
      void gameOverLost()
      this method is called if bomb is clicked or on the double click if flag is not on a bomb this method exposes all bombs and a message will appear
      void gameOverWon()
      this method exposes all the bombs, that have been avoided
      int getNumberOfSurroundingFlags(int x, int y)
      get the number of surrounding flags
      int surroundingBombs(int x, int y)
      //checks surrounding 8 squares for number of bombs (it does include itself, but has already been checked for a bomb so it won't matter)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(javax.swing.JLabel bombs,
             java.awt.Panel mainPanel,
             int rows,
             int columns,
             int numberOfBombs)
        constructor
        Parameters:
        bombs - set the initial number of bombs and the number will be updated each time a flag is set
        mainPanel - when creating field, so it can be added to maiPanel
        rows - for the number of rows in the fields matrix
        columns - for the number of columns in the fields matrix
        numberOfBombs - for the number of bombs

        Returns:

      • surroundingBombs

        public int surroundingBombs(int x,
                            int y)
        //checks surrounding 8 squares for number of bombs (it does include itself, but has already been checked for a bomb so it won't matter)
        Parameters:
        x -
        y - the coordinates for the field for which it give the number of set bombs
        Returns:
        the number of the surrounding bombs

        Parameters:

        y -

      • CheckSurroudingFieldForZeroAndExpose

        public void CheckSurroudingFieldForZeroAndExpose(int x,
                                                 int y)
        this is what checks if a surrounding button has "0" is so expose it and checkZeroAndExpose around the exposed buttons until there is no more "0"'s
        Parameters:
        x -
        y - the coordinates for the field

      • checkZeroAndExpose

        public void checkZeroAndExpose(int x,
                               int y)
        first calls the exposeTheSurroundingField because field[x][y] has surroundingBombs(x,y)=0 then calls the surrounding bombs method to check if the newly exposed fields still have surroundingBombs(x,y)=0\ the process is repeated until there are no more fields with 0 unexposed
        Parameters:
        x -
        y - the coordinates for the field

      • checkPressedButtonsWin

        public void checkPressedButtonsWin()
        checks if all the button without bombs have been pressed If so the game is won

      • gameOverWon

        public void gameOverWon()
        this method exposes all the bombs, that have been avoided

      • gameOverLost

        public void gameOverLost()
        this method is called if bomb is clicked or on the double click if flag is not on a bomb this method exposes all bombs and a message will appear
